hero.title: Know Your Rights. Protect Your Community.
hero.description: Immigration enforcement and police are used to divide and intimidate the working class. Know your rights, prepare your family, and stand together so no one faces ICE or the courts alone. This is how we fight back.

emergency.subtitle: I need to know my rights or prepare my family.

kyr_home.disclaimer: Disclaimer: These materials are for information only, not legal advice. Always consult a trusted attorney or legal worker about your specific situation.

sections.rights_prep_title: Know Your Rights & Prepare Your Family
sections.rights_prep_intro: The most important tools you have are the right to remain silent and the right to not consent to searches. Memorize them. Teach them to your family. The guides below provide step-by-step instructions for what to do in common situations.

emergency_box.text: If someone has already been detained or is being detained right now, call the VWN hotline immediately at {phone} and read our {link}.

get_involved_section.title: From Knowledge to Action: Stand with the Working Class
get_involved_section.intro: Knowing your rights is the first step. The next is acting collectively. The bosses and landlords use immigration status to keep wages low and crush organizing for everyone. When we stand together, we make it harder for them to operate in silence and fear. This is how we build power.

subsection_a.title: Direct Support & Community Defense
subsection_a.copy: We organize volunteer teams to observe ICE check-ins and accompany people to high-risk appointments. Our presence provides community protection, documents state activity, and ensures no one disappears alone. This is not charity; it is disciplined, working-class solidarity.

button_1.text: Sign up for an ICE Check-In Coverage shift
button_1.subtext: Observe and log activity outside the Stockton ICE facility.

button_2.subtext: Support people at check-ins, court dates, and other appointments.

button_3.subtext: Spread information by canvassing, tabling, and giving presentations to your family or congregation.

subsection_b.title: Political Commitment
subsection_b.h3: Build a United Front of the Working Class
subsection_b.copy: We are building a united front of workers in San Joaquin County—farmworkers, tenants, congregations, and union members—independent of both major parties. We will not be divided by papers, race, or language. We will organize where we live and work until no employer can threaten a worker into silence and no family faces these crises alone.

button_1.text: Read & Sign the United Front Letter
button_1.subtext: Show that San Joaquin's working class stands with our immigrant neighbors.

button_2.subtext: Become a member of a democratic, fighting organization.

request_support.title: Support for Your ICE Check-In or Appointment
request_support.intro: You do not have to face this alone. If you have an upcoming ICE check-in or other high-risk appointment, you can securely share your information with us. We will do our best to support you.

section1.title: How We Can Help
section1.p1: We are volunteers, not lawyers. We keep your information confidential and only share it with trusted members of our team who are directly involved in your support. We will never share your details with ICE, police, or your employer.
section1.p2: Based on your request and our volunteer availability, we can try to:
list: Organize volunteers outside the building during your appointment time.
Call or text you before your appointment to check in.
Call or text you after your appointment to confirm you are safe.
Contact your emergency person and community hotlines if we believe you may have been detained.

form.title: Confidential Support Request
form.intro: Please fill out the form below. The more information you provide, the better we can prepare to support you.

next_steps.title: What Happens Next
steps: A trusted WCU coordinator will review your request.
We will contact you via your safe phone number to confirm we received your information and let you know what support we can realistically provide.
We prioritize higher-risk cases and will always be honest about our volunteer capacity. We cannot guarantee someone will be present in person, but we will always do our best.

emergency.text: If someone has already been detained or is being detained right now, do not use this form. Go to our {link} or call the VWN hotline immediately at {phone}.

about_page.title: They Have Their Parties. We Need Our Own Organization
about_page.p1: The bosses and landlords have two political parties. The working class needs a fighting organization of its own.
about_page.p2: Across San Joaquin, rents rise while our wages stall. Bosses demand more while giving less. Both the Democratic and Republican parties answer to their donors, not to us.
about_page.p3: Our political and economic system is not broken; it is working exactly as designed to protect the profits of the wealthy by keeping the rest of us divided and powerless. It makes us too poor to live in and own the homes we’ve built, too poor to eat the food we’ve grown and served, too poor to benefit from the fruits of our labor.
about_page.p4: We refuse to accept this. We are organizing a mass working-class movement to build the genuine democracy we deserve – one where working people have real control over our lives, our communities, and our economy. We are not a political party. We organize collectively through mass membership. We do not have to continue relying on politicians, lobbying them, and hoping that they side with us over their donors.
about_page.p5: Working Class Unity is just as the name suggests, an organization fighting to unite the working class, to give individuals in San Joaquin control over their lives. We demand truly affordable and safe housing, workplace autonomy, protection of our communities from police oppression, and accountability from our elected officials. Our mission is to strengthen working class power by forging alliances between labor and tenant unions and social movements through education, advocacy, and direct action.
about_page.p6: We fight for our families. For the future prosperity of our children. Whatever your race, your creed, your birthplace - don’t stand by and let the wealthy tear down this country that each one of us has helped build.
about_page.p7: Together, we can build a member-run movement in San Joaquin County that wins concrete victories, without the compromises and betrayals of politicians and their wealthy donors.

hero.title: collective, class-conscious power
hero.description: If you believe in mass organizing over fighting alone, in democracy over monied interests, and in building class-consciousness over supporting the status quo, you are already one of us. There is a war being waged against the working class. Join us and fight back.

rank_and_file.title: Membership
rank_and_file.description: Become a rank and file member.

solidarity.title: Solidarity
solidarity.description: Become a rank and file member. Paying more does not get you additional benefits, but it does let us print more flyers.

donate.title: Donate - One Time
donate.description: If you cannot become a member but still want to support WCU, you can make a one time donation.

benefits.title: Rank and File Membership
benefits.description: Joining Working Class Unity means actively shaping the organization's direction, taking responsibility for actions, and engaging in our campaigns.

voting.title: Voting Rights
voting.description: Members participate in all decision-making processes and determine the direction of our organization.

leadership.title: Leadership
leadership.description: All members are eligible to hold any office or serve on any committee within our organization.

campaigns.title: Campaigns
campaigns.description: Our campaigns primarily aim to advance socialism and build power for the working class.

education.title: Education
education.description: Members work together to produce political educational material & organizing skill trainings.

faq.title: FAQ
faq.subtitle: Frequently Asked Questions About Membership and Participation

eligibility.question: What are the eligibility requirements to become a member of Working Class Unity?
eligibility.answer: To be eligible for membership in WCU, individuals must be in good standing and either reside, work, or attend school or church in San Joaquin County, California.

good_standing.question: What does it mean to be a member in good standing?
good_standing.answer: Members in good standing have paid their dues (with a 30-day grace period), attended at least one regular meeting per year, adhered to WCU’s values and mission, and have not engaged in behavior that violates WCU’s Code of Conduct.

dues.question: Why do you have membership dues?
dues.answer: WCU is fully funded by Member dues and donations. By not taking large donor or government grants, we are able to focus solely on our mission and the interests of the working class without external influence.

contact.question: Can I talk to someone before joining?
contact.answer: Yes, of course! You can schedule a quick call with a member of the Steering Committee by {link}.

hero.title: We will not abandon our neighbors.
hero.subtitle: Independent Check-In Monitoring & Accompaniment
hero.description: The system relies on people being alone. We rely on solidarity. We need people at the local ICE facility to ensure no one disappears in silence.
hero.appointment_help_text: Click here if you need someone to watch out for you.

orientation.heading: Onboarding Video
orientation.caption: Watch: How we monitor, how we log, and how we stay safe.

schedule.heading: Claim Your Shift
schedule.arrival: Arrival: You must arrive 15 minutes early to to get a clipboard and get a briefing from the previous volunteer.
schedule.role: Role: You are an observer. You log arrivals/departures and provide resources.

notice.text: Emergency detention tactics change. Before every shift, open this page to see the current instructions for what to do if someone is detained.

end_of_shift.heading: AFTER YOUR SHIFT
end_of_shift.copy: Your shift isn't over until the data is safe.

debrief.title: 1. The Debrief
debrief.description: Tell us how it went. How many safe check-ins? Did you see ICE agents? How did you feel? You'll receive a link via email/SMS.

logs.title: 2. The Logs (Security Protocol)
logs.drop_off: DROP OFF the physical sheets at the WCU Office Mail Slot:

contact.heading: ORGANIZER SUPPORT
contact.description: Unsure about protocol? Speak to an organizer.

public_areas.title: Public areas (no permission needed):
public_areas.description: Lobbies, dining rooms, and retail spaces. Entry alone does not grant authority to stop, question, or arrest anyone.

private_areas.title: Private areas (permission required):
private_areas.description: ICE needs a judicial warrant signed by a judge—not a DHS order. If an employee or employer consents, ICE can enter without a warrant.

rights_at_work.title: Your rights at work
list: Remain silent.
Refuse searches.
Refuse to show documentation or ID.
Stand together in the center of the room. Refuse to separate by immigration status. ICE uses this tactic to isolate individuals—protect each other.

header.title: Protocol: ICE Interaction.
header.subtitle: Follow these steps immediately if approached at your home.

do_not_consent.title: Do not consent to a search
do_not_consent.say: SAY: “I do not consent to entry.”
do_not_consent.do_not: DO NOT: Open the door or step outside.
do_not_consent.do: DO: Record from inside your home.

ask_id.title: Ask for identification
list: Request badge numbers and names.
Record or write down this information.

no_warrant.title: If they claim to have no warrant or you see it lacks a judge’s signature:
list: Say: “I exercise my right to remain silent.”
Say: “You cannot enter without my consent.”
Keep the door closed.

has_warrant.title: If they claim to have a warrant:
list: Request they slide it under the door or display it at a window.
Photograph the warrant.

check_items.title: Check these four items:
list: Issuing authority: Must be from a COURT, not Homeland Security or ICE.
Subject identity: Your correct name and address must appear, not someone else’s.
Expiration date: The “execute by” date must be within 14 days.
Signature: A judge or magistrate must sign it, not an immigration officer.

if_enters.title: If ICE enters your home
list: Record these violations: force, violence, intimidation, lies, or excessive searching.
If you cannot film during the incident, record yourself describing what happened as soon as possible afterward.

always_pull_over.title: Always pull over
always_pull_over.content: Pull over when any law enforcement signals you to stop, even if you do not think you did anything wrong.
always_pull_over.recording_tip: Start recording. If alone, place the phone in a cup holder or pocket while recording continues.

warning.title: Warning
warning.content: ICE uses unmarked vehicles and may wear plain clothes or vests labeled “POLICE” without identifying themselves as immigration.

window.title: Your window
window.content: Roll down your window slightly when asked.

providing_info.title: Providing information

drivers.title: Drivers must provide:
list: Driver’s license.
Registration and proof of insurance.

passengers.title: Passengers
list: Cannot be forced to show ID.
Cannot be forced to give name, address, legal status or place of birth.

advice: Request officer identification before presenting any documents.
Do not lie or give false documents.

all_occupants.title: For all occupants:
list: Decline to discuss immigration status or criminal history.
all_occupants.say: Am I free to go? I do not consent to provide ID or answer questions.

exiting.title: Exiting the vehicle
exiting.content: Officer may order you to get out for “officer safety.” This order often precedes arrest.
exiting.warning: Officers may force removal if you delay.

search_limitations.title: Search limitations
search_limitations.content: ICE needs a judicial warrant or your consent to search:
list: Your body (beyond a pat-down).
The inside of your vehicle.
Glove compartment or trunk.
search_limitations.say: I do not consent to any searches.
search_limitations.repeat: Repeat this even if officers proceed anyway.

fingerprints.title: Fingerprint collection

when.title: ICE can take fingerprints only when:
list: Officers suspect immigration violations.
You are under arrest.

if_requested.title: If requested without a clear cause:
list: Ask: “Why am I being fingerprinted?”
Say: “I do not consent to fingerprinting.”

fingerprints.resistance: Do not physically resist. Verbal objection may protect your legal rights.

tactics.title: ICE Tactics
list: Follow you near your home or in public spaces.
Wear plain clothes without identifying themselves.
Call out your name to confirm your identity.

stopped.title: If stopped by ICE
stopped.silent: Stay silent. Do not state your name or answer questions.

if_yes.title: If they say YES:
steps: Walk away calmly if they let you.

if_no.title: If they say NO:
steps: SAY: “I will not answer questions. I want a lawyer.”
Do not lie, show false documents, or run.

protect.title: Protect Yourself
list: Record the encounter or ask someone to record. Remember that anything you say in that recording can be used against you, so stick to repeating your rights.
When requesting help, avoid saying your name. Give them a contact's name to send the video.
Carry an emergency card with your lawyer's and family’s contact information.
If searched without consent: Say, “I do not consent to this search. I want a lawyer.”

unitedfront.title: A United Front of the Working Class: San Joaquin County Stands Together Against the Persecution of Immigrants and the Intimidation of Workers
unitedfront.subtitle: They want us to be afraid and divided.

whatWeFace.heading: WHAT WE FACE
whatWeFace.content: Across the country, immigration enforcement and police surveillance disrupt daily life in neighborhoods, schools, workplaces, and churches. Our coworkers and our neighbors are questioned and detained with little regard for fairness or due process. Though we are not seeing the same level of activity as Chicago and Los Angeles, we must not let that make us complacent.

whoWeAre.heading: WHO WE ARE
whoWeAre.content: We are farmworker committees, tenant unions, religious congregations, and union members in San Joaquin County. Our commitment is simple: this is our Central Valley, we will protect one another, and we will act together.

ourPrinciples.heading: OUR PRINCIPLES
ourPrinciples.content1: We are organizing to prevent fear from dividing the working class. Fighting each other over crumbs to cover the costs for healthcare, housing, and survival has always been a fools game. The labor movement's slogan "an injury to one is an injury to all" remains true. We understand when immigrant workers are targeted, the wages, well-being, and power of every worker are weakened.
ourPrinciples.content2: But our response must not be panic. Instead, we must organize and fight in a disciplined manner. Our anger, outrage, and compassion must be transformed into deliberate and long term organizing and solidarity.
ourPrinciples.content3: Speak the language of class. No employer or official should be able to use immigration status to silence workers, steal wages, evict families, or break unions. Immigrants' strength is part of the strength of the whole American working class.

unitedFront.heading: A UNITED FRONT
unitedFront.content: A united front brings together working-class organizations around shared goals. It is independent of the two major parties and institutions of the capitalist class. This is not a popular front that subordinates us to the program or candidates of the Democratic Party. We cooperate with those who respect our independence and the leadership of working-class organizations.

whyStandTogether.heading: WHY WE MUST STAND TOGETHER
whyStandTogether.content: Large corporations, and their allies in government, impose exploitation and war abroad, forcing millions to migrate to survive. The same ruling class then blames immigrants for crises caused by corporate greed, hoping to fracture the working class and keep wages low. When undocumented workers are kept in fear, employers can threaten deportation to crush organizing and drive down pay. That hurts the entirety of the working class. The answer is not to turn on each other; the answer is to unite and fight the bosses together.

whyNeitherParty.heading: WHY NEITHER DEMOCRATS OR REPUBLICANS WILL SAVE YOU
whyNeitherParty.content: Both parties answer to big money. Republicans campaign on open attacks against immigrants and unions. Democrats offer kinder words but have presided over mass deportations and expanded enforcement, while leaving working-class cities to shoulder costs of migration without support. The result is predictable: people already struggling with housing and services are pitted against new arrivals for resources neither group should have to fight over. We reject the propaganda that our only choices are one party's cruelty or the other's empty promises. We build independent, organized working-class power.

notSlogans.heading: NOT SLOGANS ALONE - ORGANIZING AND PERSUASION
notSlogans.content: The immigrant struggle cannot be confined to viral slogans as if words alone could change reality. Outbursts of energy must be converted into patient, disciplined organizing rooted in workplaces, neighborhoods, schools, and congregations. We must explain our situation clearly, do the hard work, and persuade.

longTermDemands.heading: OUR LONG-TERM DEMANDS
longTermDemands.intro: We fight to defend San Joaquin County, and a country, where every worker can live and work with dignity, safety, and equal rights.
longTermDemands.demand3: Real enforcement of labor rights for all workers, regardless of status
longTermDemands.demand4: Citizenship for all who are already here and real pathways to citizenship for future immigrants

pledge.heading: OUR PLEDGE
pledge.content: We will not abandon our neighbors. We will not be divided by papers, race, language, party, or zip code. We will build a united front of workers in San Joaquin County, one independent of the politicians and corporations that profit from our fear. We will organize where we live, work, and worship until no employer can threaten a worker into silence and no family faces these crises alone. Join us today.

tenetUnion.title: Tenet Union Work
tenetUnion.description: Supporting healthcare workers in their fight for fair wages and better working conditions at Tenet hospitals across the Central Valley.

tenantUnion.title: Tenant Union
tenantUnion.description: Organizing tenants to fight for housing justice, fair rents, and protection against unjust evictions in our communities.

ceasefirePalestine.title: Cease Fire in Palestine
ceasefirePalestine.description: Advocating for an immediate ceasefire and humanitarian aid access in Gaza. Standing in solidarity with Palestinian civilians.

medicareForAll.title: Medicare for All
medicareForAll.description: Building grassroots support for universal single-payer healthcare. Everyone deserves quality healthcare regardless of income.

knowYourRightsWorkshops.title: Know Your Rights Workshops
knowYourRightsWorkshops.description: Educational workshops helping community members understand their constitutional rights when interacting with law enforcement and ICE.

communityCanvassing.title: Community Canvassing
communityCanvassing.description: Door-to-door outreach to connect with neighbors, share resources, and build working class power in our communities.

fundraiserDrive.title: Fundraiser Drive
fundraiserDrive.description: Our annual fundraising campaign to support organizing efforts and community programs throughout the year.
